abstract.text: A layout that provides a custom, interactive view inside the transcript.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use a live layout instance to create custom, interactive messages in the transcript (or input field). An alternative layout is required to represent your message on devices that don’t have your iMessage app installed, or on devices that aren’t running iOS 11 or later. Note: this could be either the receiver’s or the sender’s device; the sender may have a second device that doesn’t have your app installed.
Set the alternative layout when you instantiate your
object. Use an
instance. The template layout automatically provides support for devices that do not support iMessage apps (macOS, iOS 9 and earlier, and SMS devices). See below for an example.
Listing 1. Sending a live message.
When an
object with a live layout is added to the transcript (or input field), the system instantiates a new instance of your
subclass, with its
property set to the
value.
The view controller’s
property is set to the interactive message just before the controller’s
method is called. Use the
property to access the message and display its contents.

The Messages app renders your controller’s view inside a bubble in the transcript.  Your controller must check its presentation style and display an appropriate user interface for the message. You can define the message’s size by overriding your view controller’s
method.
There can be multiple live messages (from multiple iMessage apps) in the transcript at the same time. This means your app may have multiple instances of its
subclass running concurrently:
One instance for each message in the transcript
One instance for a message in the input field (when you stage the message by calling
One instance for the app’s main interface if your iMessage app is currently active

abstract.text: Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.
Inserts a message object into the Messages app’s input field.
The message that the user selected in the conversation transcript.
A custom message object.
An abstract base class that defines the appearance of
objects in the conversation transcript.
A layout that provides a custom, interactive view inside the transcript.
A template layout to be displayed when the live layout is unavailable.
Initializes a new live layout using the provided alternate layout.
A template-based layout for custom messages.
The iMessage app is displayed in the Messages app’s transcript or input field.
The size of your messages view, given the provided maximum size.
The principal view controller for iMessage apps.
The extension’s current presentation style.
Invoked just before the Messages extension becomes active.
A session object used to create and update messages.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
